articles.author: JULIA FRANKEL
articles.description: TEL AVIV, Israel (AP) — The Israeli military said Friday that it has dismissed two officers and reprimanded three others for their roles in drone strikes in Gaza that killed seven aid workers on a food-delivery mission, saying they had mishandled critical information and violated the army’s rules of engagement.
articles.title: Israel dismisses 2 officers over deadly drone strikes on aid workers in Gaza

articles.author: JULIA FRANKEL
articles.description: TEL AVIV, Israel (AP) — The Israeli military said Friday that it has dismissed two officers and reprimanded three others for their roles in drone strikes in Gaza that killed seven aid workers on a food-delivery mission, saying they had mishandled critical information and violated the army’s rules of engagement.
articles.title: Israel dismisses 2 officers over deadly drone strikes on aid workers in Gaza

articles.author: MATTHEW LEE
articles.description: LEUVEN, Belgium (AP) — U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken said Friday that the measures the Israeli government has announced to expand the flow of aid into Gaza are welcome but may not be enough to meet the Biden administration’s demands for dramatic improvements in humanitarian conditions in the territory.
articles.title: Blinken says Israeli offers to increase flow of aid to Gaza are welcome but may not be sufficient

articles.author: JOSEF FEDERMAN
articles.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — When Israel declared war against Hamas last October, it stood unified at home and enjoyed broad backing from around the world following an unprecedented attack by the Islamic militant group.
articles.title: After six months of war, Israel's isolation grows with no end in sight

articles.author: AMIR VAHDAT
articles.description: TEHRAN, Iran (AP) — Iran's commander of the powerful Revolutionary Guard General Hossein Salami said Friday “no threat will go unanswered” in retaliation for the airstrike widely attributed to Israel that destroyed the Iranian Consulate in Syria's capital and killed seven of the guard's members, including two top generals.
articles.title: Iran's Revolutionary Guard head vows payback for apparent Israeli strike that killed top generals

articles.author: NICHOLAS RICCARDI and LINLEY SANDERS
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Like many Americans, Richard Bidon says he'd like to see the U.S. government “go back to its original design” — a system of checks and balances developed nearly 240 years ago to prevent any branch, especially the presidency, from becoming too powerful.
articles.title: Americans think a president's power should be checked, AP-NORC poll finds — unless their side wins

articles.author: MICHELLE L. PRICE
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Former Defense Secretary Mark Esper has called him a “threat to democracy.” Former national security adviser John Bolton has declared him “unfit to be president.” And former Vice President Mike Pence has declined to endorse him, citing “profound differences.”
articles.title: Former Trump officials are among the most vocal opponents of returning him to the White House

articles.author: JOHNSON LAI and CHRISTOPHER BODEEN
articles.description: HUALIEN, Taiwan (AP) — Rescue teams are searching for a family of five feared trapped in a rockslide following Taiwan’s biggest earthquake in 25 years, which has left at least 12 dead.
articles.title: Rescue teams in Taiwan searching for family feared trapped in rockslide following earthquake

articles.author: RODNEY MUHUMUZA and IGNATIUS SSUUNA
articles.description: HUYE, Rwanda (AP) — The diggers’ hoes scrape the brown soil, looking for — and often finding — human bone fragments. The women then wipe the bone pieces with their hands as others watch in solemn silence.
articles.title: New mass graves in Rwanda reveal cracks in reconciliation efforts, 30 years after the genocide

articles.author: DAVE COLLINS
articles.description: A major spring storm brought heavy snow, rain and high winds to the Northeast, downing trees and power lines and leaving nearly 700,000 homes and businesses without power at one point. A woman was killed by a falling tree in a New York City suburb and a second woman died in a New Hampshire fire caused by the weather.
articles.title: April nor'easter with heavy, wet snow pounds Northeast, knocks out power to hundreds of thousands
